subject: Communication
title: Thomas-Kilmann's Five Conflict Styles
description: A short lesson to help you apply Thomas-Kilmann's Five Conflict Styles.

hook.text: When conflict arises, some people fight. Some flee. Some fold. Some negotiate. Some collaborate. Which are you?

buildup.text: Thomas and Kilmann identified five styles: Competing, Avoiding, Accommodating, Compromising, and Collaborating.

discovery.text: Each style balances two dimensions: assertiveness (your needs) and cooperativeness (their needs).

twist.text: No style is universally best. Competing works in emergencies. Avoiding works when issues are trivial.

climax.text: Most people default to one style in all situations. Mastery means choosing the right style for each conflict.

punchline.text: Conflict style isn't personality. It's a choice â€” if you know your options.

quiz.question: How many conflict styles did Thomas and Kilmann identify?
